com.cloudant.sync.indexing
Class FieldIndexFunction

java.lang.Object
  com.cloudant.sync.indexing.FieldIndexFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
IndexFunction<java.lang.Object>
public class FieldIndexFunction
extends java.lang.Object
implements IndexFunction<java.lang.Object>

FieldIndexFunction is a simple IndexFunction which extracts values from a document based on the fieldName given to it.

It will return the value from the first level of the document in the field specified verbatim. For example, for the document: 

     {
         "hello": "world",
         "foo": ["bar", "baz"]
     }

If the the constructor is passed "hello" as a field name, indexedValues will return ["world"]. For "foo", it will return ["bar", "baz"].

          Creates a FieldIndexFunction object that will return the value for fieldName.

 java.util.List<java.lang.Object> indexedValues(java.lang.String indexName, java.util.Map map)

public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> indexedValues(java.lang.String indexName,

Specified by:
indexedValues in interface IndexFunction<java.lang.Object>
Parameters:
indexName - The name of the index the values are destined for
map - The document being indexed
Returns:
An object representing the value to be indexed. This must match the index's defined type.
